metadata.metaValue: Set collision shape property on the mesh. Any points that instance this mesh will use also instance its collision shape.
Since ever other point is twisted, we want each rotated either +90 or -90 degrees relative to the next.
Constraint frames describe how the constraint is attached. Imagine picking up an object with a pair of tweezers, the frame would be to position and orientation of the tweezers relative to the object.
An invalid point id (such as -1), indicates the other body should be constraint to the world.

Rigid bodies chained together with constraints. 

It's possible to create a chain held together by collisions between links, but the constraints method is very cheap and stable.
Its important disabled_collision is 'true' so we don't have to worry constrained pairs intersecting.
Chain bullet simulation example. Use interactive playback to interact in real time
